name: Kangaroo Steak
description: Lean red meat native to Australia
nutrition: High in protein, iron, and zinc. Very low in fat.
preparation: Best served medium-rare, can be grilled, pan-fried, or barbecued
taste: Similar to venison, slightly gamey flavor
benefits: Sustainable meat source, heart-healthy, muscle building

name: Lamington
description: Traditional Australian cake covered in chocolate and coconut
preparation: Cube sponge cake, dip in chocolate icing, roll in coconut
taste: Sweet, moist cake with chocolate and coconut flavors

name: Pavlova
description: Meringue-based dessert topped with cream and fresh fruit
preparation: Whip meringue, bake until crisp outside and soft inside, top with cream and fruit
taste: Light, sweet, and creamy with fresh fruit flavors
benefits: Contains vitamin C from fresh fruits

name: Barramundi
description: Australian native fish, popular in Queensland cuisine
nutrition: High in omega-3 fatty acids, protein, and vitamin D
preparation: Can be grilled, baked, pan-fried, or used in curries
taste: Mild, sweet flavor with firm white flesh
benefits: Brain health, heart health, anti-inflammatory properties

name: Meat Pie
description: Australian savory pastry filled with minced meat and gravy
preparation: Fill pastry with seasoned meat mixture, bake until golden
benefits: Good source of protein and iron
season: Popular during AFL season and winter

name: Tim Tam
description: Chocolate biscuit consisting of two chocolate malted biscuits separated by chocolate cream
preparation: Factory-produced, often enjoyed with Tim Tam Slam technique

name: Vegemite
description: Dark brown Australian food spread made from yeast extract
nutrition: High in B vitamins, particularly B12, folate, and niacin
preparation: Spread thinly on toast or bread, often with butter
taste: Strong, salty, umami flavor - acquired taste
benefits: Rich in vitamins, supports nervous system health

name: Anzac Biscuits
description: Sweet biscuits made with oats, flour, sugar, butter, golden syrup, and coconut
preparation: Mix dry ingredients, add melted butter and syrup, bake until golden
taste: Sweet, chewy, with oat and coconut flavors

name: Macadamia Nuts
description: Native Australian tree nuts with rich, buttery flavor
nutrition: High in healthy monounsaturated fats, fiber, and manganese
preparation: Eaten raw, roasted, or used in baking and cooking

name: Damper
description: Traditional Australian bread made from wheat flour and water
preparation: Mix ingredients, knead lightly, bake in camp oven or regular oven
taste: Plain, slightly dense bread with neutral flavor
